This stunning debut cookbook by internationally renowned and award winning pastry chef Kirsten Tibballs is the definitive guide to the art of chocolate and pastry.

This award winning book features exquisite recipes for you to make including entremets, chocolate bars, tarts, macarons, petit gateaux and much more.
- Over 60 new concepts & recipes
- For the home or professional chef

- Clear and precise chocolate theory for that perfect finish
- Award winning book for Best Photography in the UK at the Gourmand World Cookbook Awards.

description:
Paillete Feulletin is the perfect companion if you want to play with contrasts in taste and texture. Its delicious taste is highly compatible with chocolate. At the same time, its crunchiness will give your pralines, tablets, pastries and desserts even more depth and refinement. Use it to give smooth centres a crispy bite. Paillete Feulletin is tiny pieces of crunchy wafers.

description:
Jean-Pierre Wybauw has been an advisor and instructor with Barry-Callebaut for thirty-two years. He constantly travels around the globe teaching professionals the tricks of the trade. In this fascinating book, Wybauw delivers a comprehensive and practical guide to the art of chocolate making. This book contains comprehensive sections on commonly used ingredients, chocolate processing, extending shelf life, tools and equipment and more.

This book contains dozens of recipes, including sections on ganaches, caramels, nougat, fruit-based, marzipan and more, complete with stunning photography.

This beautifully-presented book was named the Best Chocolate Book in the World by the Gourmand Cookbook Awards, and is an essential addition to any chocolatier's library.

"So Good" is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts.

So Good has a large international coverage, and some of the world's most prominent master pastry chefs,  glaciers and chocolatiers grace its pages.  It can be found in the kitchens of the world's most prestigious bakeries, pastry shops, restaurants, gourmet shops, hotels and schools.

The exclusiveness of this magazine is a result of its select content, based on the collaboration and recipes of the best pastry chefs with numerous step-by-step explanations. The most interesting interviews, the latest trends in the trade, the most important international events, and the latest gourmet products... All this accompanied by an impeccable edition, an elegant and sleek design and high-quality photographs.

Issue: 8

Language: English

Pages: 280

Size: European oversize - 11 3/4" x 9"

Printed: Biannually

"So Good" is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts.

So Good has a large international coverage, and some of the world's most prominent master pastry chefs,  glaciers and chocolatiers grace its pages.  It can be found in the kitchens of the world's most prestigious bakeries, pastry shops, restaurants, gourmet shops, hotels and schools.

The exclusiveness of this magazine is a result of its select content, based on the collaboration and recipes of the best pastry chefs with numerous step-by-step explanations. The most interesting interviews, the latest trends in the trade, the most important international events, and the latest gourmet products... All this accompanied by an impeccable edition, an elegant and sleek design and high-quality photographs.

description:
Faux Bois structure sheet.

CLEARANCE STOCK

 

Issue: 10

Language: English

Pages: 284

Size: European oversize - 11 3/4" x 9"

Printed: Biannually

"So Good" is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts.

So Good has a large international coverage, and some of the world's most prominent master pastry chefs,  glaciers and chocolatiers grace its pages.  It can be found in the kitchens of the world's most prestigious bakeries, pastry shops, restaurants, gourmet shops, hotels and schools.

The exclusiveness of this magazine is a result of its select content, based on the collaboration and recipes of the best pastry chefs with numerous step-by-step explanations. The most interesting interviews, the latest trends in the trade, the most important international events, and the latest gourmet products... All this accompanied by an impeccable edition, an elegant and sleek design and high-quality photographs.

Featured chefs and articles in this issue:

- Gregoire Michaud,  Taste and shape
- Miguel Sierra, The corn egg
- Joseph Baker, A flower bath
- Ryosuke Sugamata, With unconventional techniques
- Philippe Vancayseele, Chocolate is beautiful
- Philippe Conticini, The taste of maturity
- Frank Haasnoot, The challenge continues
- Jérôme de Oliveira, ‘It’s not me who decides which product will become a specialty, ...’
- Marc Ducobu, Belgian and multicultural excellence
- Javier Guillén, Back to basic
- Bobby Schaffer, Less is more
- Thomas Raquel, Thanks for the memories
- Will Goldfarb, Why not a new meringue?
- Christian Hümbs, Aroma-menu at the boundaries of patisserie
- Juan Pablo Cortés, Pure, dark forms
- Yukihiko Kawaguchi, Designing the melting speed
- Christian Bau, Cosmpolitan
- Gabriele Riva, Geometry of form and flavor
- Olivier Fernández, Customized éclairs
- Antonio Bachour, The “wow” factor
- Martín Lippo, Yogurt d’auteur, a new path
- Talita Setyadi, Choosing the best
- Gerhard Petzl, Baroque chocolate
- Jordi Puigvert, ‘I’ve always been determined to improve and simplify the recipes’
- Dominique & Xavier Noel, US pastry competition
- Mast Brothers Chocolate, It's artisanal and it looks like
Related product: Chocolate to Savour - Kirsten Tibballs, so good.. Issue 9
Short description: So Good.. magazine is a biannual professional journal dedicated to the world of patisserie and dessert.

Meta Description: So Good Magazine is a professional journal dedicated to the world of patisserie and dessert.

Product name: 128g AmeriColor Soft Gel Paste Food Colour (4.5oz)
description:
AmeriColor Soft Gel Paste 128g (4.5oz)

These represents a completely new approach to food colour formulation, delivering superior results over conventional food colours.
Each bottle of AmeriColor Soft Gel Paste contains 4.5oz (128g) of highly concentrated colouring and comes in a convenient squeeze bottle.
You can use AmeriColor Soft Gel Paste for colouring dough, whipped toppings, icing, fondant, gum paste, etc.
 
Made in the USA, FDA approved is certified kosher.

 

Colours range from:

  • Avacado (NEW)

  • Chocolate Brown

  • Deep Pink

  • Leaf Green

  • Lemon Yellow

  • Orange

  • Regal Purple

  • Royal Blue

  • Super Black

  • Super Red 

 

This is one of the standard products used in classes at Savour Chocolate and Patisserie School.

description:
Chablon Eclair Mat: This food grade rubber stencil enables you to create individual eclair shaped chocolate discs, to garnish your finished eclairs.

Size: 6 eclair shapes 132x32mm 

Directions of use:  Place the chablon mat onto a guitar sheet or transfer sheet on a flat tray, spread a thin layer of chocolate onto the chablon and scrape off the excess. Remove the chablon immediately and place the sheet of stenciled chocolate onto a slightly curved surface to set. Allow to set and remove the chablon to reveal your individual discs.Chablon Mat Eclairs
Short description: Chablon Eclairs mat, for creating eclair shaped chocolate discs to garnish your finished product.

description:
Temperature measurements are among the tasks carried out daily in the food sector. Only by taking precise measurements can you monitor and guarantee the quality of your products. The testo 108 allows spot-check measurements in seconds. Whether in the transportation and storage of foodstuffs, in restaurants, in large kitchens or in chain restaurants.

The testo 108 allows temperature measurement to be integrated into daily work routines with no added complications, helping the user comply with HACCP requirements and certified according to EN 13485. Two self-explanatory buttons for easy application even by frequently changing staff any standard probe Type T and Type K with miniature TC plug connectable Probe (108-1 model only) can be stowed directly in softcase Always hygienic: Simply clean the softcase and the probe under running water Large, clear display.

Parameter °C / °F
Operating temp. -20 to +60 °C
Storage temp. -30 to +70 °C
Probes Type T (Cu-CuNi), Type K (NiCr-Ni) (108-1 only)
Protection Class IP67
Features Auto-Off
Standard EN 13485
Short description: Testo Waterproof Thermometer 108, takes measurements that you monitor, to guarantee the quality of your products.
Meta title SEO: Testo Thermometer
Meta Description: Testo Waterproof Thermometer 108, takes measurements that you monitor, to guarantee the quality of your products.

description:
Learn the recipes of master patissier Christophe Adam, with over 40 recipes including the classics (chocolate, vanilla, coffee), seasonal (strawberry, lemon, raspberry) and creative (hot dog,  foie gras, tuna mimosa) and more.

Christophe Adam is a former executive pastry chef at world famous Fauchon Patisserie. His stellar career has also included Gavroche in London, the first establishment outside of France to have three Michelin stars, the Roux brothers' patisserie, Hotel De Crillon in Paris and Beaurivage Palace in Switzerland. Christophe now owns his own establishments, L'Eclair de Genie and Adam's Paris.

Christophe is acclaimed as one of the best patissiers in the world, which shines through in his endless experience, innovative creations and four stunning books. His eye for detail and innovative techniques set trends across the world.

This cookbook is in French only with easy to follow recipes and stunning photography.
Related product: Choux Pastry, Eclairs

description:
Learn to make delicious Christmas-themed eclairs developed exclusively for Savour Chocolate & Patisserie School by award-winning chef Paul Kennedy in this one-day class.

Treat your family and friends these holidays with decadent christmas flavours, all topped with Christmas-themed garnishes.

After attending this course, you will have gained the experience and skills to master perfect christmas eclairs, which you could replicate at home for many christmases to come!

You will take home a selection of your creations to enjoy with your family and friends.

In this class you will learn:
- Brand new eclair recipes developed by Paul Kennedy created exclusively for this class

- Making and piping the choux pastry

- A number of cream fillings

- Delicate garnishing techniques

- Innovative sable coating

- Exciting christmas flavour combinations and textures

- New and innovative products

- Techniques for home or commercial use

Some of the flavours you will create*:

- Steamed pudding with custard

- Lebkuchen

- Trifle

* Flavours subject to change.

* All products in the photos have previously been made by our students in class
Short description: Treat your family and friends these holidays with decadent christmas eclairs, all topped with Christmas-themed garnishes.
Meta title SEO: Christmas Eclairs
Meta Description: Treat your family and friends these holidays with decadent christmas eclairs, all topped with Christmas-themed garnishes.
Categories: Classes -> Pastry & Tarts, Classes -> Christmas Classes

description:
Cristeaux Verts chocolate transfer sheets

Directions of use: Place the transfer sheet with the slightly textured side facing up. Spread a layer of melted chocolate on the surface and set. Cut shapes and or roll the sheet as desired. Place in the fridge for a five to ten minutes and remove the plastic.

Store: Store the transfer sheets between 15-22ºC.

Size: 40 x 25cm

description:
This mouthwatering book presents 38 of the finest pastry chefs working worldwide today, together with samples of their glorious, highly sophisticated confections.

Some of the chefs are up-and-coming, others are well established; all are innovative pioneers in a uniquely appealing creative field.

Profiles of each patissier include an informative biography giving a sense of their individual style.

Also included are scores of recipes for world-class cakes, tarts, biscuits, petits fours, plated desserts, pastries, confectionery, chocolate, ice creams and sorbets, with a final chapter focusing on the lavish sugar-paste world of celebratory cakes.

Offering a wealth of inspiring and delicious material, this book is a must for professional pastry chefs, keen amateurs and anyone interested in the gourmet lifestyle.

Format: Hardback, 288 pages

Mini-Brisures chocolate transfer sheets

Directions of use: Place the transfer sheet with the slightly textured side facing up. Spread a layer of melted chocolate on the surface and set. Cut shapes and or roll the sheet as desired. Place in the fridge for five to ten minutes and remove the plastic.

Store: Store the transfer sheets between 15-22ºC.

description:
Chocolate World Starter Kits come with all of the equipment you need to start making your own moulded chocolates!

The kit includes:

- 1 x Palette knife

- 1 x Digital Thermometer

- 1 x Polycarbonate chocolate mould*

- 16 x Disposable piping bags

- 1 x Scraper

 - Booklet containing step by step instructions and two recipes.

This kit comes in a beautifully packaged box, and is a perfect gift idea for an aspiring chocolate maker.

* Please note that the mould included in the pack is chosen at random by our supplier.

This kit is on sale for a limited time from the regular price of $109.

description:
This pack is a must-have for any serious chocolate lover!

 

The pack includes:

One copy of Kirsten Tibballs' Chocolate to Savour

This stunning debut cookbook by internationally renowned and award winning pastry chef Kirsten Tibballs is the definitive guide to the art of chocolate and pastry.
This award winning book features exquisite recipes for you to make including entremets, chocolate bars, tarts, macarons, petit gateaux and much more.
- Over 60 new concepts & recipes
- For the home or professional chef
- Easy to follow instructions with step-by-step photos
- Clear and precise chocolate theory for that perfect finish
- Award winning book for Best Photography in the UK at the Gourmand World Cookbook Awards.

One copy of A World of Chocolate

The World Chocolate Masters is the world's premier culinary competition devoted solely to the art of chocolate. The team behind this prestigious competition have released a stunning book documenting each finalist's journey throughout the competition.

"A World of Chocolate" follows the 2011 competition across each country and through all the stages, photographing the stunning creations along the way and including all recipes from the winners and runners up.

Together with chef profiles and all you need to know about chocolate, this is the definitive guide to the world's most well-loved ingredient.
Related product: Callebaut Dark Crispearls 800g, Callebaut White Crispearls 800g, Scraper Large Metal Red, Coloured Cocoa Butter 100g
Short description: The perfect gift for any chocolate lover: A World of Chocolate and Chocolate To Savour.

description:
This pack includes:

 

One copy of Tartes, Gouters and Entremets

This beautifully-presented, professional cookbook by MOF chefs, Stephane Glacier and Gaetan Paris, contains over 40 unique recipes for tarts, petit gateaux, vienoiseries, petit fours and more.

With step-by-step photos and extra sections on techniques and basic recipes, this cookbook is ideal for professionals.

Each recipe contains instructions on glazing and garnishing, along with diagrams for assembly.

One copy of Verrines et Petits-Gateaux

This beautifully-presented, professional cookbook by MOF chefs, Stephane Glacier and Gaetan Paris, contains recipes and techniques for making verrines, petit gateaux and more.
With step-by-step photos and extra sections on techniques and basic recipes, this cookbook is ideal for professionals.
Each recipe contains instructions on glazing and garnishing, along with diagrams for assembly.

Product name: Fine Chocolates, Great Experience Books I and II
description:
WAS $260.00

NOW $225.00

 

This pack includes:

 

One copy of Fine Chocolates: Great Experience

Jean-Pierre Wybauw has been an advisor and instructor with Barry-Callebaut for thirty-two years. He constantly travels around the globe teaching professionals the tricks of the trade. In this fascinating book, Wybauw delivers a comprehensive and practical guide to the art of chocolate making. This book contains comprehensive sections on commonly used ingredients, chocolate processing, extending shelf life, tools and equipment and more.

This book contains dozens of recipes, including sections on ganaches, caramels, nougat, fruit-based, marzipan and more, complete with stunning photography.

This beautifully-presented book was named the Best Chocolate Book in the World by the Gourmand Cookbook Awards, and is an essential addition to any chocolatier's library.

 

One copy of Fine Chocolates 2: Great Ganache Experiences

After the international success of "Fine Chocolates - Great Experience", this book by Jean-Pierre Wybauw is a comprehensive and innovative guide to all things ganache.

This book contains detailed information on ingredients, flavour, recipe substitions, sugar, shelf life, and much much more.

Complete with beautiful recipes and stunning photography, this in-depth guide is a fantastic addtion to any chocolate-lovers library.
Related product: Chocolates & Pralines - Level 1, Chocolates & Pralines - Level 2, 6L Chocolate Melting Tank
Short description: A comprehensive introduction to the art of handmade chocolates and an in-depth discussion about the science of ganache by Callebaut chef Jean-Pierre Wybauw.

Language: English

Printed: Biannually

"So Good" is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts.

So Good has a large international coverage, and some of the world's most prominent master pastry chefs,  glaciers and chocolatiers grace its pages.  It can be found in the kitchens of the world's most prestigious bakeries, pastry shops, restaurants, gourmet shops, hotels and schools.

The exclusiveness of this magazine is a result of its select content, based on the collaboration and recipes of the best pastry chefs with numerous step-by-step explanations. The most interesting interviews, the latest trends in the trade, the most important international events, and the latest gourmet products... All this accompanied by an impeccable edition, an elegant and sleek design and high-quality photographs.

  • 1kg of Callebaut 811 53.8% Dark Couverture
  • 1 30mm Half-Sphere Chocolate Mould 
  • 1 Metal Scraper

 

Please Note: that chocolate is susceptible to high temperatures. While we take every care in packaging items to mail, we cannot guarantee that they will arrive undamaged during warmer months. Shipping any temperature sensitive items between September and April is at the risk of the buyer.

description:
Soft Gel Paste represents a completely new approach to food colour formulation, delivering superior results over conventional food colours.
Each bottle of AmeriColor Soft Gel Paste contains 4.5oz (128g) of highly concentrated colouring and comes in a convenient squeeze bottle. You can use AmeriColor Soft Gel Pastes for colouring dough, whipped toppings, icing, fondant, gum paste, etc. Made in the USA, FDA approved is certified kosher.
This is one of the standard products used in classes at Savour Chocolate and Patisserie School.

 

This pack includes:

 

  • Super black
  • Royal Blue
  • Orange
  • Royal Purple
  • Chocolate Brown
  • Deep Pink
  • Leaf Green
  • Lemon Yellow
  • Super Red
Related product: Almond Paste (MARZIPAN) 50% – 1kg, Luster Powder 2g (Metallic)

description:
This guitar cutter is made of heavy-weigt, durable polycarbonate, and makes cutting chocolates a breeze. It comes with:

  • 1 x 39 x 45 x 13cm base
  • 1 x 22.5mm frame
  • 1 x 30mm cutter
  • 1 x 45mm cutter
  • 1 stainless steel sheet
  • 1 x scraper ruler
  • 3 extra strings
  • 2 spanners for tightening and loosening the strings
  • This guitar must not be used to cut frozen cakes, chocolate blocks or other hard products.

description:
Has silicone teeth to ensure that clean lines are created. The teeth are set 3mm apart on one side, 4mm apart on the other.

Applications for use: Comb melted chocolate onto strips of acetate and as it starts to set roll the acetate to create curls. Let the chocolate set then remove the plastic. It can also be used for decor paste and two tone chocolate cigarettes.

description:
Strawberry Slices - 22g

Inside is the highest quality, ripe and sweet fruit and then freeze-dry it to produce intensely flavoured fruits and powders.

Add to icings, to your favourite brulee mix or smoothies. Chocolate dip the whole/sliced fruits, crumble them over ice cream, add to your cereal or just eat them as they are. All packed in re-sealable foil bags.

Freeze drying locks in superior flavour, taste, colour and aroma. They are simple and versatile to use....and a little goes a very long way.

Fresh As are packed in resealable foil packs for longer lasting freshness.
Short description: Strawberry Fresh As freeze dried fruits are packed in resealable foil packs for longer lasting freshness.

Product name: Demarle Macaron Silpat 585 x 385mm - Full Size
description:
These innovative Silpat mats from Demarle come with a template drawn on, making macaron piping a breeze! Make perfectly shaped and spaced macarons with these long lasting non-stick baking mats.

Size: 585 x 385mm. The external diameter of the rings is 35mm.

Silpat® Non-Stick Baking Mats are designed for every type of oven. From savory to pastry baking, nothing sticks to Silpat®. It is reusable for thousands of uses and provides even heat transfer to baked goods. Use your Silpat® everytime you bake!

Issue: 11

Language: English

Pages: 306

Size: European oversize - 11 3/4" x 9"

Printed: Biannually

"So Good" is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts.

So Good has a large international coverage, and some of the world's most prominent master pastry chefs,  glaciers and chocolatiers grace its pages.  It can be found in the kitchens of the world's most prestigious bakeries, pastry shops, restaurants, gourmet shops, hotels and schools.

The exclusiveness of this magazine is a result of its select content, based on the collaboration and recipes of the best pastry chefs with numerous step-by-step explanations. The most interesting interviews, the latest trends in the trade, the most important international events, and the latest gourmet products... All this accompanied by an impeccable edition, an elegant and sleek design and high-quality photographs.

Featured chefs and articles in this issue:
Kirsten Tibballs, a festive look

Albert Adrià and Oriol Balaguer, ‘Being copied is an honor. Only the good ones are copied’

description:
WAS $59.95

NOW $45.00 

Limited Stock Available!!

Out of print

The most extensive, complete and up-to-date recipe collection in haute pâtisserie

“What is the quickest way to find the recipe for lavander pudding that was published in one of the earliest editions of so good.. magazine? How can I get modern recipes for the sponge cakes made by the world’s best pastry chefs? What different options do I have when preparing a fruit gélatine?”

In response to these and many other questions we offer you sogood.. recipes, the most extensive, complete and up-to-date recipe collection in international haute pâtisserie. In one unique volume we have included a complete index of all the recipes published in the first eight volumes of sogood.. magazine.

Not only does it include a compilation of all the recipes (cakes, dessert plates, petit fours…) but also their components. For example, the reader will find a section on dark chocolate mousses and within it, recipes for all the dark chocolate mousses ever published in sogood.. magazine (numbers 1 to 8). So, in this case, we are talking about no less than 26 dark chocolate mousse recipes, created by masters of the likes of Angelo Musa, Carles Mampel, Albert Adrià and Stéphane Glacier…among others.

And so too with ice creams (27), sorbets (32), fruit jellies (50), sponge cakes (54), dacquoises (16), egg-free creams (48), croustillants, caramels, jams, ganaches, sablés… and so on, up to a total of 1144 recipes by 120 different authors.

The opportunity to cook up this giant recipe collection arose due to the high level of demand from numerous pastry chefs throughout the world, who were not content to purchase only the most recent volume of the magazine, but who wanted to buy all the previous volumes. And so all our magazines sold-out. Faced with the impossibility of re-publishing them, we came up with the concept of sogood.. recipes.

Ultimately, this great collection from sogood.. magazine enables you to:

  • Access all the recipes from sogood.. magazine in one single volume
  • Enjoy those recipes from volumes that were previously sold-out
  • Possess the most extensive and complete recipe collection of haute pâtisserie in existence, with a total of 1144 recipes belonging to the top pastry chefs of the world.

Short description: All of the recipes from so good... 1-8. A must-have for any serious lover of sweets!

description:
Introducing new and advantageous ingredients, simplifying the processes, improving the performance and applications of each product; in short, optimizing the technical side of pastry to the maximum. This is what evolutionary pastry is about, which Jordi Puigvert practices and teaches all over the world as a technical advisor for countless firms. And this is in fact the subject which this book, published by Grupo Vilbo and So Good.. magazine, revolves around.


In a didactic way, and with numerous step-by-step pictures for each technique, the book focuses on the so-called ‘technological’ ingredients, revealing their little known applications in pastry products. Puigvert proves that there are ingredients available to the artisans nowadays which do not subtract quality or nobility from a product at all, but allow to obtain magnificent results regarding texture, preservation and better interaction with other ingredients.


Jordi Puigvert has traveled the world teaching pastry and culinary professionals the results of his research and technical progresses. As for the regular courses he gives, places like Hong Kong, Italy, Singapore, the USA or Taiwan –among other– are usual on his agenda.

 

1. Ingredients: If there is a natural ingredient, with an origin and extraction method similar to that of the usual ones, and which provides us with practical and specific solutions in our daily tasks, why shouldn’t we use it?
2. Applications: Jordi Puigvert has deeply researched the technical possibilities of gelling and thickening agents, emulsifiers, etc. with a very clear objective – offering the pastry professional specific solutions to fight off everyday problems.
3. Recipes: In this section, all the complete recipes worked throughout the book are compiled. It is a total of 20 creations of modern pastry (cakes, desserts, marshmallows, macaroons, etc.) with over 60 components, as well as their final assembly.

 

How can we whip a meringue without applying heat, without using egg whites and still obtaining the greatest stability?

How can a gelatin withstand temperatures of up to 80ºC –for example inside a cake– and still hold its structure?

How can we keep a frozen product from losing water while thawing?

How can we make a cuttable pistachio praliné without the need for chocolate couverture or cocoa butter?

How can we easily turn a regular mousse into a frozen one without modifying the basic recipe?

 

Find the answers to these questions and more inside EVOLUTION.
Related product: so good.. Issue 11
Short description: Techniques and ingredients for modern pastry by Jordi Puigvert

description:
In this brand new seasonal class, learn to make decadent petit gateaux with Christmas-themed flavours and garnishes.

After attending this course, you will have gained the experience and skills to make these beautiful individual cakes, which you could replicate at home for many christmases to come!

You will take home a selection of your creations to enjoy with your family and friends. The petit gateaux can be consumed immediately or frozen for your festive parties!

In this class you will learn:
- A range of petit gateaux recipes created exclusively for this class

- To make crispy centres, delicious light mousses and soft fruit centres

- Evenly layered gateaux that look as beautiful when cut open as they do on the outside

- Decorating, glazing and garnishing techniques.

The recipes for this class are currently under development by the Savour chefs. Images and flavours of these delicious petit gateaux will be added to the website shortly.
Related product: Christmas Chocolates, Petit Gateaux, Petit Gateaux Continuing Education
Short description: Learn to make a range of delicious petit gateaux with Christmas-themed flavours and garnishes in this one day class. The petit gateaux can be consumed immediately or frozen for your Christmas festivities.
Meta title SEO: Christmas Petit Gateaux
Meta Description: Learn to make a range of delicious petit gateaux with Christmas-themed flavours and garnishes in this one day class. The petit gateaux can be consumed immediately or frozen for your Christmas festivities.
Categories: Classes -> Patisserie & Cakes, Classes -> Christmas Classes

description:
Learn to create a range of delicious Christmas-themed tarts in this hands-on class.

Suitable for beginners or cooks wanting to expand their recipe repertoire, this class will teach you to make a variety of tart shells with a range of fruit, chocolate and cream fillings. 

By the end of this class, you will be able to create exceptional tarts and replicate them each Christmas in your own kitchen.

You will take home a selection of your creations to enjoy with your family and friends.

In this class you will learn:

· Create the perfect pastry shell

· Festive flavours and garnishes

· An understanding of the different types of pastry

· Exciting recipes for you to take home

The recipes for this class are currently under development by the Savour chefs. Images and flavours of these delicious Christmas tarts will be added to the website shortly.
Related product: Tarts Level 1, Tarts Continuing Education, Tart Ring 160 d x 22 h S/S, Christmas Petit Gateaux

description:
Learn to make delicious Christmas-themed entremets in this exclusive one-day class. 

This class will cover two different mousse-based cakes, each with a range of delicious seasonal flavours.

Learn to correctly glaze your cakes and make delightful edible Christmas garnishes.

You will take home a selection of your creations to enjoy with your family and friends. The cakes can be consumed immediately or frozen and enjoyed on Christmas Day.

In this class you will learn:

· Mouth-watering mousse cakes

· Seasonal fillings, including baked and frozen centres

· Professional glazing

· Festive garnishing

· Exciting flavour combinations and textures

· Techniques for home or commercial use

The recipes for this class are currently under development by the Savour chefs. Images and flavours of these delicious petit gateaux will be added to the website shortly.
Related product: Entremets / Gateaux, Entremets / Gateaux Continuing Education, Christmas Petit Gateaux, Christmas Tarts

description:
Callebaut Belgium Hot Chocolate is a real, rich hot delight, so much more than the regular hot cocoa drink. Finest Belgian hot chocolate is 100% genuine chocolate, generously treating you with it’s indulgent chocolate taste and rich cocoa butter mouth feel. A delight no cocoa drink can bring.

Cocoa Solids: 53.8%

description:
Lignes structure sheet.

Design: Shallow, narrow straight lines. 

Directions of use: Spread melted chocolate onto the sheet and as it sets cut shapes with a knife or set in a full sheet and break into pieces once set. Set the chocolate on the structure sheet before peeling the structure sheet away. Metallic powder can be added to the surface of the structure sheet before applying chocolate to add some colour and more gloss. Structure sheets can be re-used multiple times.

Size: 40 x 25cm
Related product: Callebaut 823NV Milk Couverture 33.6% - 2.5kg Callets, Large Angled Palette Knife
Short description: Use Lignes Structure Sheets to create your own chocolate textures.

description:
WAS $39.95

NOW $30.00

 

LIMITED STOCK

 

Issue: 12

Language: English

Size: European oversize - 11 3/4" x 9"

Printed: Biannually

so good issue 12 focuses on the consistent work of female pastry chefs. Until now they have been in the minority, but perhaps not for much longer. 

Features of so good issue 12 include:

Kirsten Tibballs, owner of a fabulous cooking school in Melbourne and one of our muses in so good.. magazine, transports us to a world of surprises: a landscape of ash, lava and magma, from which emerges all that is magic in life.

Lauren V. Haas, the head instructor at the Johnson and Wales University, College of Culinary Arts (New England), introduces her beautiful Orange Passion and convinces us that passion and heart come before skill in the execution of her art.

The French Claire Damon tells us about her devotion to Nature and the lessons it has taught her. She shows us her elegant and personalised aesthetic approach. Versatility is the greatest virtue for the North American Megan Galus, chef at the prestigious Park Hyatt Chicago Hotel. She manages to produce to perfection a grapefruit pavlova while at the same time preparing an incredible chocolate croissant.

Janice Wong is experiencing an extraordinarily dynamic period in her professional career. She is currently preparing a second book of her free creations (No References), has renovated and strengthened the dessert menu of her 2am:Dessert Bar in Singapore and become more and more interested in 3D printers for her edible art performances, while still finding time to create an enjoyable line of pastilles with a bamboo base.

Next is the Colombian Melissa Coppel, chocolatier by profession and dessert lover by vocation, who always tries to bring freshness and imagination to her chocolate bars, bonbons and desserts. She co-manages a chocolaterie with Jean-Marie Auboine in Las Vegas and they have gained notoriety in the United States as a force for creativity and elegance.

Plus much more...
Short description: So Good.. edition 12 is a biannual publication from Spain, written in English, and aimed at professionals of sweet and savoury pastry, chocolate and desserts. <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="200" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/KWXKP-j33_E?rel=0" width="300"></iframe>

description:
WAS $39.95

NOW $34.00

 

This book features ice cream recipes taken from the prestigious magazine Arte Heladero, which draws on more than 30 years of experience in the sector. The book brings together more than 200 recipes that have appeared in the magazine in recent years, organised into 13 groupings and accompanied by technical articles about the processes used in the making of ice cream, written by Pablo Galiana and Enrique Coloma.

Ice creams, sorbets, ices, slushes, semifreddoes and other important elements that accompany ice cream such as marbling, crunchy pastry, biscuit layers, coatings and much more, fill the 199 pages of the book. It is an authentic collection of the best that the ice cream world has to offer, including the most recent trends, derived from the craftsmanship of the best known professionals.

The great Artisanal Ice Cream Recipe Book is a fundamental tool, not only for those who wish to be initiated into this marvellous craft, but also for those seeking a useful guide on how to create complete recipes using the most original combinations of ice creams and their accompaniments, specifically designed for today’s ice cream professional.

Technical information

- Technical articles on the processes involved in the making of ice cream, written by Pablo Galiana and Enrique Coloma
- 217 recipes
- 81 professionals
- 13 groupings of ice creams and accompaniments
- 199 pages

description:
40% OFF!!

 

WAS $69.95

NOW $42.00

 

shall we play?

A macaroon which resembles a yo-yo, candy marbles, a pirate bonbon, marzipan tennis balls… these are just some examples of what the readers will find in this singular book. It is not a matter of trivializing the noble trade of pastry, nor of attacking traditional pastry and petit-fours. The great sweet buffets, the elegance and historic relevance of traditional specialties… in one word, good old pastry, will always have a reserved space in the gastronomic world. For this reason, there is no incompatibility with exploring new paths, such as that of ‘fun pastry’.

The teachers from the Pastry Guild School of Barcelona, led by their director Olivier Fernández, invite us to play, to set our imagination free, to create in an open and outgoing way. This attitude is strongly related to the new phase towards which this school is evolving – a liberalizing, non-conformist age, as well as unifying when it comes to new trends, styles and ways of understanding and practicing pastry, good pastry. Undoubtedly, a modernization phase, a moment to become up-to-date and look into the future, but always respecting tradition and basic essentials.

This book is a good sample of the creative and reformist mentality of the young, professional group of teachers from that school in Barcelona.

Technical Information:
Title: play
Author: Escuela de Pastelería del Gremio de Barcelona.
- 128 pages.
- More than 100 photos.
- Step-by-step preparation instructions.
- All recipes fully in detail.
Short description: A macaroon which resembles a yo-yo, candy marbles, a pirate bonbon, marzipan tennis balls… these are just some examples of what the readers will find in this book.

description:
Properties: Gelling

Use: Mix in liquid, bring to boil, let cool down.

Applications: Any liquid elaboration

Elaborations: Hard caviar / Hot gelatines (<90°C)

Other Elaborations: Gelatines/ Purees/ Veils / Foams Dose: 2-15g/KG depending on desired harness degree

Product name: A World of Chocolate – Signed by Frank Haasnoot
description:
WAS $59.00

NOW $39.90

 

Personally signed by 2011 World Chocolate Master Frank Haasnoot, as a recent guest chef at Savour Chocolate & Patisserie School.

Only 7 copies available!

The World Chocolate Masters is the world's premier culinary competition devoted solely to the art of chocolate. The team behind this prestigious competition have released a stunning book documenting each finalist's journey throughout the competition.

"A World of Chocolate" follows the 2011 competition across each country and through all the stages, photographing the stunning creations along the way and including all recipes from the winners and runners up.

Together with chef profiles and all you need to know about chocolate, this is the definitive guide to the world's most well-loved ingredient.

Don't miss out on this very limited, extra special gift!

description:
Filaments structure sheet

Design: various narrow straight lines

Directions of use: Spread melted chocolate onto the sheet and as it sets cut shapes with a knife or set in a full sheet and break into pieces once set. Set the chocolate on the structure sheet before peeling the structure sheet away. Metallic powder can be added to the surface of the structure sheet before applying chocolate to add some colour and more gloss. Structure sheets can be re-used multiple times.

Product name: Tradition in Evolution - Leonardo di Carlo
description:
This is the bible of pastry. Three years of research, analysis, testing, discussion, analysis and comparisons to achieve the goal: to offer the natural evolution of the "Handbook of Italian Pastry". A flexible instrument ideal for today's professionals.
Over 800 pages of dense and technical illustrations: not only recipes, but all the tools to build their own way of working and to evolve, through tools and ideas to "get" PASTRY , made ??of study, practice tests, technique, emotion and creativity. Hence the concept of creative science, according to a modern and dynamic.
The manual covers all the key issues, the puff pastry to the masses assembled, from pasta to cream puffs biscuit, from creams of various kinds to the meringues, the leavened dough to cake, from tea biscuits to praline, from chocolate to pâte à bombe, from ice cream to icings, from soufflé to nougat, from jams to crisp, candied from the fried pastry alternative and that salty ...
A unique and comprehensive approach to pastry in all its magnificent shades.

Includes:

scientific explanations and technical
insights practical
tips
recipes
variants
strengths and weaknesses
processes summarized
notes and tricks
Short description: This is the bible of pastry. Over 800 pages of dense and technical illustrations: not only recipes, but all the tools to build their own way of working and to evolve, through tools and ideas to "get" PASTRY.

LIMITED STOCK - ONCE THEY'RE GONE, THEY'RE GONE!

Want to create the most 'out there' cake ever? You can! These transfers were first used by Kirsten Tibballs during her "Style Rebellion" presentation at the Callebaut Ambassador Seminar in Spain.

Warning: These transfers will blow people's minds.

Directions of use: The circle OMG transfer is for the top of the entremet. The thin pyramid transfer is for the base around the entremet. Place the transfer sheet with the slightly textured side facing up. Spread a layer of melted chocolate on the surface and set. Cut shapes and or roll the sheet as desired. Place in the fridge for five to ten minutes and remove the plastic. 

Store: Store the transfer sheets between 15-22ºC.

Size: 40 x 25cm

Please note that transfer sheets are susceptible to high temperatures. While we take every care in packaging items to mail, we cannot guarantee that these will arrive undamaged during warmer months. Shipping any temperature sensitive items between September and April is at the risk of the buyer.

description:
Author: Oriol Balaguer
Language: english / spanish
Pages: 306
Size: 23 x 29.7 cm

Obsession is the expression of a creator in his highest professional fulfillment. Oriol Balaguer leaves his mark on a work of great beauty that takes pastry to the peak of culinary art.

The type of obsession Oriol Balaguer suffers from is great, as it is projected in multiple manifestations. His is an obsession for quality, for a job well done, for perfection, for continuously learning and improving, for beauty, for harmony, balance, aesthetics and the presentation of his creations, for the packaging of all his collections.

Balaguer is not a specialist, unless someone can be so many things at once. He is definitely one of the best chocolatiers in the current scene, with bonbon collections and unique artistic work. His restaurant desserts marked an era, with such sublime pieces such as his ‘Eight Textures of Chocolate’, the best dessert in the Coupe du Monde de la Pâtisserie in 2001. But if we talk about baked or fermented doughs, his butter croissant has been awarded as the best in Spain in 2014. Therefore, Balaguer does not stand out in any one particular facet; he stands out in almost all of them. And this is due to the cited ‘almost obsessive’ level of requirement he faces each recipe, each elaboration, each new creation and every project.

The book consists of cakes, desserts, petit fours, pastries and bakery, bonbons, artistic chocolate ... More than 80 creations of incomparable beauty by the hand of one of the greatest creators in current sweet cuisine internationally.essive’ level of requirement he faces each recipe, each elaboration, each new creation and every project.

description:
Number of pages: 304
Measures: 230 x 297 cm
Language: English
Features of so good.. Issue 14 include:

  • albert adrià, la dolça, ticket’s sweetest ring 
  • rené frank, a pinch of madness and a high dose of good sense 
  • scott green, nice, balanced, possible… happy  
  • angelo musa, the thrice-crowned king  
  • gustaf mabrouk & hans ovando, knocking borders down 
  • damien piscioneri, bright, luxurious, refined 
  • william curley, classical refinement 
  • futoshi hashimoto, enclose every flavor the ingredient has 
  • antonio bachour, shockwave 
  • nicolas jordan, ice cream at the center of discourse 
  • jean-marie auboine, ‘I want my customers to continue experiencing ...’ 
  • philippe rigollot, with studied simplicity 
  • brian campbell, feeling the land on the plate 
  • yann menguy, the peaceful evolution 
  • tetyana verbytska, cultivating ukrainian haute patisserie 
  • philippe segond, ‘for the french, pastry is a full-fledged art’ 
  • jérôme chaucesse, ‘to obtain the title, you have to ...’ 
  • christophe renou, ‘this distinction is not an outcome but ...’ 
  • julien boutonnet, ‘I decided to take courses in sophrology ...’ 
  • tidbits
  • yoshihiro narisawa, japan, epicenter of all things 
  • alex atala, brazilian spokesman 
  • grant achatz, blurring the lines between sweet and savory 
  • juan mari & elena arzak, sweet sensationalism 
  • benoît violier, best of both worlds 
  • la fabrique givrée, subzero cuisine 
  • biagio settepani, the soul of new york’s pastry

description:
Language: English

Antonio Bachour is one of the most prolific pastry chefs in the world. His creations seem to come out so easily and quickly yet all of them taste as good as they look. “Chocolate” is Bachour’s third book in 3 years and nothing like the first two.

This book will include Entremet, Petit Gateaux, Verrines, Tarts, Bonbons and Chocolate Plated Desserts.

Alan Batt, known to everyone in the industry as Battman, is a legend in the food photography world. He takes these pictures to a new level, elevating a recipe book into an art book with passion and dedication present in every single stunning shot.

The renowned pastry chefs Oriol Balaguer and Carles Mampel from Spain penned the foreword.

description:
Spots (Taches) chocolate transfer sheets

Directions of use: Place the transfer sheet with the slightly textured side facing up. Spread a layer of melted chocolate on the surface and set. Cut shapes and or roll the sheet as desired. Place in the fridge for five to ten minutes and remove the plastic.

Store: Store the transfer sheets between 15-22ºC.

Size: 40 x 23cm

Please note that transfer sheets are susceptible to high temperatures. While we take every care in packaging items to mail, we cannot guarantee that these will arrive undamaged during warmer months. Shipping any temperature sensitive items between September and April is at the risk of the buyer.

description:
Like eating an apple, this fresh tasting tea is great to drink at any time of the day. Sweet in taste, Apple-Tree makes an excellent dessert tea. A great aid to healthy eating, as a cup of Apple-Tree can help stave off sugar cravings while providing a great boost of Vitamin C.

CAFFEINE FREE
Ingredients: Pyrus Mali Fructus (Apple Pieces), Ascorbic Acid & Natural Acerola (Vitamin C), Citric Acid (Natural Preservative), Natural Apple Flavor. Flavor: Fresh, sweet apple flavor.

Preparation: Bring fresh, cold water to the boil. Infuse 1 teaspoon of loose leaf tea or 1 tea bag per person in a cup or a teapot. Allow to steep for 3 to 5 min for desired taste.
Short description: Like eating an apple, this fresh tasting tea is great to drink at any time of the day. Sweet in taste, Apple-Tree makes an excellent dessert tea. A great aid to healthy eating, as a cup of Apple-Tree can help stave off sugar cravings while providing a great boost of Vitamin C.

description:
Australiana Tea, a refreshing combination of Australia's native plants, eucalyptus & lemon myrtle. It is a reflective of our Landscape and the people who inhabit it. Cool, dry and vast with a whole lot of soul. A true Aussie brew!!!

ORGANIC - CAFFEINE FREE

Ingredients: Lemon Myrtle (Backhousia Citriodora), Sage (Salvia Officinalis), Eucalyptus Leaf (Eucalyptus Globulus).

Preparation: Bring fresh, cold water to the boil. Infuse 1 teaspoon of loose leaf tea or 1 tea bag per person in a cup or a teapot. Allow to steep for 3 to 5 min for desired taste. Best served without milk, hot or chilled.
Short description: Australiana Tea, a refreshing combination of Australia's native plants, eucalyptus & lemon myrtle. It is a reflective of our Landscape and the people who inhabit it. Cool, dry and vast with a whole lot of soul. A true Aussie brew!

Product name: Panes con oficio - True Bread - Joaquin Llaras
description:
The book is divided into a very extensive introduction in which the main ingredients of bread are studied and another part devoted to the basic preparation stages, particularly focusing on the different types of sourdough starters and natural leavening agents. The chapter on breads is the most ambitious, and displays a large number of step-by-step preparations which range from classic breads, such as Galician bread, baguette or peasant’s bread, to those which belong to a new generation of particularly healthy ones, such as organic, spelt, tritordeum or Kamut bread. Italian specialties play a special role in this book, and are a reflection of the experience which the author himself gained in that country. Focaccia, ciabatta Bolognese, pane all’oglio and even panettone are fully explained in the pages of this book, with step-by-step photographs which will surely help reveal their own essence.

- More than 25 different breads and 15 enriched breads.

- Color photography of all breads, with different finishes and step by step explanations.
- Working with natural fermented starters and specialty flours.

Introduction to the world sugars, syrups, sugar, baking.

Product name: Secret Recipes from the World Famous New York Bakery - Dominique Ansel
description:
Everyone wants to know: How does Dominique do it?

Dominique Ansel is the creator of the Cronut pastry, the croissant-doughnut hybrid that has taken the world by storm.

But he's no one-hit wonder. Classically trained in Paris, leader of Daniel Boulud's three-Michelin-starred pastry kitchen in New York and now the proprietor of New York's highest-rated bakery, Dominique has become a modern-day Willy Wonka: the creator of wildly innovative, extraordinarily delicious and unbelievably popular desserts.

Presented here are some of Dominique's most coveted recipes, organised by skill level and catering to both amateur and professional bakers.

Beginners can conquer the Chocolate Pecan Cookies with the molten chocolate centre; more experienced bakers will learn the secrets to the exquisite caramelised crust of this Cannele de Bordeaux; and the most adventurous will tackle The At-Home Cronut. In this, his first cookbook, Dominique reveals not only the secrets to his hit desserts but he describes the stories of inspiration behind each of them. The most important element in any dish is not a particular brand of chocolate or a type of salt but rather the spark of imagination.

At heart, Dominique Ansel is a book about innovation: how a cook can transform flour, sugar and butter into memories that last a lifetime; and how anyone, from any field, can try to add a little magic to their work.
Related product: Chocolate to Savour - Kirsten Tibballs, Artisanal Ice Cream Recipe Book, Panes con oficio - True Bread - Joaquin Llaras, Caramel - Christophe Adam
Short description: Presented here are some of Dominique's most coveted recipes, organised by skill level and catering to both amateur and professional bakers.

Product name: Patisseries et Gourmandises, tendances et traditions - Stephane Glacier
description:
Fifteen years after receiving the title of Meilleur Ouvrier de France, Stéphane Glacier us his new creation, in the tradition of his previous works: professional book done "by a craftsman for artisans."

"Pastries and sweets, trends and traditions "highlights the latest creations of pastry, inspired by his years of experience and his many travels (especially in Bucharest and Dubai). opening out on the gourmet trend of the moment through a first chapter on cabbage (Eclairs Paris-Brest revisited, Eclair raspberry "full fruit," Choux crumble arabica) , the book then stops on tarts and rustic pies but greedy and timeless (apple tart yuzu, rustic Tarte Sydney, creamy tart and crunchy chocolate) , continues on the simplicity and elegance of sweets and biscuits (Buds undergrowth, Duke of Burgundy Vanilla Dome lemon meringue strawberry basil) and ending with the delicacies (Romias almond Cake "clementine ingot and candied chestnuts," Moist almond milk).

A chapter also discusses basic recipes: biscuits, pastes, creams, icings, decorations and other basic recipes.

description:
Volume: 1.5oz (42.5gr)

Pure enzymatically treated soy protein which can be hydrated with water and whipped to make a foam.

 

This product can replace egg-albumin or gelatin, and exhibit a synergistic effect in combination with egg-albumin or gelatin.

 

You will be using less of this product as opposed to using egg white powder. The foam created will be more stable and with better flavour release.

 

This can be used for cold or hot foams.

 

Advantages include consistent foam quality without risk of over-beating, has a greater heat and acid tolerance and reduced microbial risk.

Product name: Iwata Gravity Spray Gun (Compressor not included)
description:
- Miniature, center post gravity feed spray gun is a full-featured HVLP gun with spray characteristics similar to Iwata’s popular RG-3 gun

- Using only 1.8 cfm at 50-60 psi, this low-air-consumption gun provides high atomization with precise control of the spray pattern and a minimum of overspray
- Features adjustable spray pattern from round to full-fan shape
- A stainless-steel nozzle, paint passage and heat-tempered needle ensure long-lasting, peak-performance spraying
- Uses the reliable and easy-to-service cartridge-style “air-valve” set, which can be serviced outside the gun and easily placed back into the gun body
- Its 4oz. (110 ml) stainless-steel gravity cup is center-mounted and comes with a friction-fit cup lid.
- Unlike siphon-feed guns, this gravity-feed cup will work with small amounts of paint without spitting
- Ideal for touch-up or custom automotive and motorcycle painting, illustration background spraying, large studio work and murals
- Spray pattern is from 1/8? to 6? (0.3 cm to 15.24 cm)

We recommend the use of a 2-3 hp air compressor that is fitted with an oil filter. Most good tool suppliers can help with these. 

 

Spray gun only. Compressor not included

description:
20%off

Now $35.50  $44.50 (RRP $49.95)

 

Luscious Recipes and Expert Know-How for Biscuits, Cakes, Sweet Treats and Desserts

This is cooking with chocolate for the home cook: luscious, decadent recipes that are both classic and contemporary...Kirsten Tibballs, dubbed 'Australia's queen of chocolate' by MasterChef Australia, runs a school for home cooks who aspire to master the delicate arts of chocolate and patisserie.

Her years of experience as a leading chocolatier and a teacher make her perfectly placed to bring together this stunning collection of recipes for all those with a sweet tooth and a desire to impress friends and family with thoroughly indulgent, chocolate-based creations.

Chocolate is always the hero ingredient and each recipe is graded for difficulty: easy, medium and tricky. Kirsten carefully maps each stage of the process with step-by-step instruction and accompanying photography so you feel as if you are being hand-held from start to finish.

From the ultimate recipe for brownies or chocolate chip cookies to coconut, raspberry and chocolate tarts, caramel chocolate mousse cake, chocolate creme brulee, milk chocolate honey truffles -- this is chocolate at its luscious, gorgeous best.

- Over 80 recipes
- Easy-to-follow instructions
- From easy biscuits to elegant cakes
- Something for any chocolate lover!

description:
SAF-Instant® Yeast Gold Label is a granular free-flowing yeast for use in doughs with sugar levels from 10-30% (Baker’s Percent).


ADVANTAGES

1. This improved version of New SAF-Instant® Gold Label provides 10% to 20 % more activity.
2. More resistant to Preservatives.
3. Provides uniform fermentation throughout your baking system.
4. Vacuum packaging ensures freshness, consistency and minimal activity loss until opened.
5. Provides tolerance to higher dough temperatures.
6. Improves machinability.
7. Free-flowing properties make it as easy to scale and meter as other dry ingredients.
8. Unopened, New SAF-Instant® Gold Label needs no refrigeration.
9. Warmer dough temperatures are preferred while using New SAF-Instant® Gold Label; this decreases the need to cool doughs to maintain proper fermentation.
10. Can reduce Mixing time 10% to 30%, compared to compressed yeast.
Short description: SAF-Instant® Yeast Gold Label is a granular free-flowing yeast for use in doughs with sugar levels from 10-30% (Baker’s Percent).

description:
Glicerina or glycerol is a thick, neutral liquid with a sweet taste, which becomes gelatinous when cooled to the touch and sight. It is a product naturally present in fermentations. It has a very high boiling point (290 ° C) and a melting point of 18ºC. It is used as a humectant and emulsifier, also to prevent fat bloom of chocolates (when fat inside the ganache comes to the surface of the chocolate). It is used in confectionery and haute cuisine as antifreeze, applied in making ice cream while lowering the sweetness of them. Glicerina is 4 times more antifreeze than table sugar. Glicerina, consumed in large quantities (more than 125 g per day is laxative). However the levels of use in the restoration and especially the consumer grams taken in a food are very small.

Properties: Anti- freezing agent, emulsifier, alleviates union between fat molecules and water
Dosage: 5-10g/kg antic-freezing agent, 2-3g/kg emulsifier
Use: Mix with desired preparation
Field of application: Ice cream, ganaches, any kind of elaboration containing water and fat
Short description: Glicerina or glycerol is a thick, neutral liquid with a sweet taste, which becomes gelatinous when cooled to the touch and sight.
Meta title SEO: Glicerina Texturizer Sosa - Savour Chocolate & Patisserie School

description:
Four in One. Four talented chefs in one book whose content is also distributed in four major thematic blocks: pastry, chocolate, desserts, and artistic. There is also a delicious story about the two decades of the Chocolate Academy in Barcelona (Spain), which is also part of the sector’s history, told in the first person by its protagonists.

A total of 432 pages of talent, creativity, modernity, and good taste, with chocolate at its center, but pushing its own limits. A book which has all the ingredients to become a great reference in today’s patisserie.

Features
72 unedited creations and over 300 recipes
Theory, technique, step-by-step processes
Languages: English/Spanish
432 pages

description:

FURTHER REDUCED

was  $49.50

Callebaut offers you a selection of fine chocolates with no added sugar. They have been made – according to Callebaut’s strict quality standards – with premium grade cocoa beans, 100% pure cocoa butter and natural bourbon vanilla. Our chocolate recipes containing maltitol as a sweetener taste nearly identical to traditional products.

Furthermore, they offer the same application possibilities, and can be processed in the same way as traditional chocolates. Their technical properties and behaviour are absolutely identical. The use of the denomination “no added sugar” on these products is allowed. Suitable for diabetics.

description:
IN STORE NOW!

So Good 17 arrives with a changed design but with the same spirit of capturing the most creative and current haute Pâtisserie. Pastry chefs such as Pierre Marcolini or Paco Torreblanca share pages with lesser known figures but which are on the rise, such as Cedric Grolet, William Werner, or Abel Bravo. Plated desserts of the new Danish cuisine or some of the chefs who have left their mark the previous year at the Ikarus restaurant in Austria will help illustrate avant-garde restaurant desserts. And if you still do not have FourinOne, you can enjoy a preview of its contents. All this and much more thanks to the participation of over 30 pastry chefs in 300 pages of content.

Contents

  • Guillaume Mabilleau, The elegance of new French vanguard
  • Pierre Marcolini, When inspiration comes from a cocoa bean
  • William Werner, A Pastry Chef for all Seasons
  • Cédric Grolet, Essential in taste, virtuoso in finishes
  • Rasmus Kofoed, Søren Selin, Jonathan Kjølhede Berntsen, Northern tides
  • Rafael Delgado, Cooking desserts
  • Paco & Jacob Torreblanca, Insights 2017
  • Gregory Doyen, Sweet seduction
  • Junichi Mitsubori, World of Wagashi. Passion in the serenity.
  • Luciano García, A Modern feel
  • Ikarus restaurant, The world in one single space
  • Stephanie Prida, California Dreamin
  • Roberto Cortez, Edible perfume
  • Javier Guillén, Breaking the mirror
  • Darren Purchese, Versioning oneself 
  • Yun Eun-Young, Korean-Style Éclairs, always crisp and fresh
  • Daniel Álvarez, The air of happiness
  • Abel Bravo, New land
  • Five New York stories
  • Tidbits
  • Gérard Dubois, That strong and barely controllable emotion
  • FOUR in ONE, Creativity with knowledge 

 

 

IN STORE NOW!

description:
Over 416 pages, 200 recipes, step-by-step photographs of the most important preparation techniques, 18 cakes and individual cakes, 24 bonbons, 10 turrons, 5 snacks, 8 desserts for restaurant, 7 petit fours and 8 bonbons for restaurant

Studies on mousses, truffles, fillings, raw materials and all the information about the most important techniques in chocolate making.
Languages: spanish / english
Description: The book is divided into four extensive sections:
CHOCOLATE AS A PRODUCT
CONFECTIONERY
CHOCOLATE MAKING
RESTAURANT

Questions:
• Do your bonbons have preservation problems? Do they dry or crystallize? Does mold appear after a few days? Learn how to balance your bonbon recipes in an easy and quick way. An extensive collection of recipes for balanced fillings is also included.
• What happens to a chocolate product while baked in an oven? We travel inside the dough to understand what happens within the heart of baked products.
• Do you want to change the type of chocolate for a different one without affecting the texture of your product?
• Do you know how to control the activity of water inside a bonbon?
• Get to know all the secrets about chocolate to obtain a good tempering, a perfect coating or a spectacular gloss.

description:
Jason’s passion for pastry, life and travel has taken him across the globe for a true culinary experience. His first internship was at Union Square Café in New York while training at the French Culinary Institute’s Pastry Arts Program.

Jason has held Executive Pastry Chef positions at the Peninsula New York, The Westin Bund in Shanghai, The Venetian Macau Hotel and Resort, The JW Marriott Hong Kong and formerly was the Corporate Pastry Chef for Cé La Vi Restaurants Worldwide. 

His win at Iron Chef Thailand is an affirmation of his elite Pastry status. His latest project, Lickerland, Asian-Accented Desserts is Jason's first cookbook featuring incredible recipes, funny stories and stunning photos due to be out in the Fall/Winter.

description:
Anarkia by Jordi Roca is a major work focused on the sweet cuisine and showcases 115 creations, depicted in 2,050 photographs and includes 105 illustrated, step by step processes.

 

This comprehensive compendium of desserts includes fundamental pastry-making techniques, preparations and ingredients in sweet cuisine. The 560 pages will take you on a journey through the most extravagant and creative desserts of recent times with creations inspired by gastronomic fanatsy.

 

The 479 recipes in Anarkia offers one of the most beautiful and unforgettable experiences.

description:
In 30 Indispensable Ice Creams the 2012 Spanish Ice Cream Champion, Jaume Turro, embarks on a journey through a complete and well-balanced compilation of ice creams. Juame takes us through ice creams as popular as vanilla or chocolate, classics such as tutti-frutti, custard or biscuit glace and as current as mojito or cheesecake, some even made with zero-mile ingredients such as strawberry, made from the fruits that he himself cultivates. 

 

This is not just an excellent compendium of recipes to fill your display case, each one of the recipes is expanded with context data about its origin, technical comments of the chosen parameters, as well as all kinds of tricks and tips from the author himself.
Related product: Chocolate to Savour - Kirsten Tibballs, Obsession - Oriol Balaguer, Eclair de Genie - Christophe Adam, Chocolate - Kirsten Tibballs, FOUR in ONE, on the boundaries of chocolate, Chocolate - Ramon Morato, Anarkia - Jordi Roca

Product name: PAST BEST BEFORE Callebaut Mini ChocRocks Dark 600g
description:
PAST BEST BEFORE

Best Before: 12/02/2017

was $19.95

NOW $9

 

100% dark chocolate for baking and decoration.

Mini ChocRocks are small chocolate bits with a rugged, uneven look and deliciously intense dark chocolate taste. They're great for sprinkling onto frothy or cream-topped drinks and slowly melt away - adding some chunky chocolate texture with a lovely bite.


They're also perfect for topping desserts and pastries to create a more robust and raw presentation. Or you can mix them into ice cream or chocolate mousse to add a chunky chocolate bite.


ChocRocks also contain less cocoa butter and easily resist oven temperatures to 200°C. You can mix them into the dough of muffins, brownies and rolls. Or you can sprinkle some on top just before the end of the baking time and leave them to bake along for just a few minutes to prevent them from melting away completely.
Short description: 100% dark chocolate for baking and decoration. Mini ChocRocks are small chocolate bits with a rugged, uneven look and deliciously intense dark chocolate taste.

Product name: PAST BEST BEFORE Callebaut Flakes Milk Large
description:
PAST BEST BEFORE

Best Before: 13/03/2017

was $33.00

NOW $5.00

 

Irregular bits in 100% milk chocolate.

With Callebaut®'s Chocolate Flakes Milk – Large, you can top off your creations with shimmering, crunchy bits of chocolate and highlight the artisan nature of your creations. These Chocolate Flakes are made of pure milk chocolate and craftily polished in a fully natural way – without the use of any shining agents.


They have an irregular semi-rectangular shape and measure between 2.7 and 6.5 mm.
 

Sprinkle them on top of your freshly dipped pralines, or decorate your pastries and desserts with these glowing bits of chocolate. When you're looking into creating a splashing, extra-festive touch, you can also mix or brush the flakes with gold, metal or coloured powder.
